markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Ghonhatine](/Monsters.aspx?ID=671)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

In transforming [xulgaths](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=102), [drow](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=37) fleshwarpers sought not to create a new type of creature but to recapture a form of xulgath predecessor believed entirely vanished from Golarion. Ghonhatines are the result—hulking reptilian beasts who prefer to crawl on all fours and tear at their foes with bestial fury.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 27

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Fleshwarp_Ghonhatine.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 10">[Ghonhatine](/Monsters.aspx?ID=671)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Aberration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=1" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 119 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent (imprecise) 30 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33)

**Languages**
[Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +21, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +19, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +19

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +3

**Con** +6

**Int** -2

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +17 

**Will** +19 

</row>

**HP** 175

**Immunities**
[disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)

**Resistances**
acid 10

**Stench** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246)) 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (plus [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +23 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d12+10 piercing plus 1d6 [persistent acid](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+10 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
vomit +19 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 5d6 acid plus fleshgout

**Feed** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirement** The ghonhatine is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour; **Effect** The ghonhatine devours a chunk of the corpse. For 1 minute, the ghonhatine gains fast healing 5 and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. It can gain these benefits from any given corpse only once.

**Fleshgout**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) A ghonhatine's vomit carries an awful disease that, over time, can cause a suffering creature's flesh to develop painful boils that eventually slough away, leaving gaping wounds; **Saving Throw** DC 28 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1d4 hours); **Stage 2** [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) and [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (1 day); **Stage 3** enfeebled 2 and drained 2 (1 day); **Stage 4** enfeebled 2 and drained 3 (1 day); **Stage 5** drained 4, enfeebled 2, and [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) (1 day); **Stage 6** dead

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Zevgavizeb's Favored</title>

The demonic patron of many [xulgaths](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=102), [Zevgavizeb](/Deities.aspx?ID=82), spends most of his time slumbering in the Abyssal realm of Gluttondark. However, his vile priests actively pursue what they insist are their dormant god's goals. Some xulgath high priests practice fleshwarping upon their own acolytes, creating [ghonhatine](/Monsters.aspx?ID=671) zealots to serve in their legions and guard their evil temples.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-47" />
name: Ghonhatine

<row gap="medium">

</additional-info>
